intro: Aegopodium involucratum, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which contain two separate seeds. Aegopodium involucratum is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
